00052 #include <errno.h>
00053 #include <stdlib.h>
00054 #include <string.h>
00055 #include <getopt.h>

00060 #define REPLACE_GETOPT          /* use this getopt as the system getopt(3) */
00061 
00062 #ifdef REPLACE_GETOPT
00063 int     opterr = 1;             /* if error message should be printed */
00064 int     optind = 1;             /* index into parent argv vector */
00065 int     optopt = '?';           /* character checked for validity */
00066 #undef  optreset                /* see getopt.h */
00067 #define optreset                __mingw_optreset
00068 int     optreset;               /* reset getopt */
00069 char    *optarg;                /* argument associated with option */
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 #define PRINT_ERROR     ((opterr) && (*options != ':'))
00073 
00074 #define FLAG_PERMUTE    0x01    /* permute non-options to the end of argv */
00075 #define FLAG_ALLARGS    0x02    /* treat non-options as args to option "-1" */
00076 #define FLAG_LONGONLY   0x04    /* operate as getopt_long_only */
00077 
00078 /* return values */
00079 #define BADCH           (int)'?'
00080 #define BADARG          ((*options == ':') ? (int)':' : (int)'?')
00081 #define INORDER         (int)1
00082 
00083 #ifndef __CYGWIN__
00084 #define __progname __argv[0]
00085 #else
00086 extern char __declspec(dllimport) *__progname;
00087 #endif
00088 
00089 #ifdef __CYGWIN__
00090 static char EMSG[] = "";
00091 #else
00092 #define EMSG            ""
00093 #endif
00094 
00095 static int getopt_internal(int, char * const *, const char *,
00096                            const struct option *, int *, int);
00097 static int parse_long_options(char * const *, const char *,
00098                               const struct option *, int *, int);
00099 static int gcd(int, int);
00100 static void permute_args(int, int, int, char * const *);
00101 
00102 static char *place = EMSG; /* option letter processing */
00103 
00104 /* XXX: set optreset to 1 rather than these two */
00105 static int nonopt_start = -1; /* first non option argument (for permute) */
00106 static int nonopt_end = -1;   /* first option after non options (for permute) */
00107 
00108 /* Error messages */
00109 static const char recargchar[] = "option requires an argument -- %c";
00110 static const char recargstring[] = "option requires an argument -- %s";
00111 static const char ambig[] = "ambiguous option -- %.*s";
00112 static const char noarg[] = "option doesn't take an argument -- %.*s";
00113 static const char illoptchar[] = "unknown option -- %c";
00114 static const char illoptstring[] = "unknown option -- %s";

00116 static void
00117 _vwarnx(const char *fmt,va_list ap)
00118 {
00119   (void)fprintf(stderr,"%s: ",__progname);
00120   if (fmt != NULL)
00121     (void)vfprintf(stderr,fmt,ap);
00122   (void)fprintf(stderr,"\n");
00123 }
00124 
00125 static void
00126 warnx(const char *fmt,...)
00127 {
00128   va_list ap;
00129   va_start(ap,fmt);
00130   _vwarnx(fmt,ap);
00131   va_end(ap);
00132 }

00134 /*
00135  * Compute the greatest common divisor of a and b.
00136  */
00137 static int
00138 gcd(int a, int b)
00139 {
00140         int c;
00141 
00142         c = a % b;
00143         while (c != 0) {
00144                 a = b;
00145                 b = c;
00146                 c = a % b;
00147         }
00148 
00149         return (b);
00150 }
00151 
00152 /*
00153  * Exchange the block from nonopt_start to nonopt_end with the block
00154  * from nonopt_end to opt_end (keeping the same order of arguments
00155  * in each block).
00156  */
00157 static void
00158 permute_args(int panonopt_start, int panonopt_end, int opt_end,
00159         char * const *nargv)
00160 {
00161         int cstart, cyclelen, i, j, ncycle, nnonopts, nopts, pos;
00162         char *swap;
00163 
00164         /*
00165          * compute lengths of blocks and number and size of cycles
00166          */
00167         nnonopts = panonopt_end - panonopt_start;
00168         nopts = opt_end - panonopt_end;
00169         ncycle = gcd(nnonopts, nopts);
00170         cyclelen = (opt_end - panonopt_start) / ncycle;
00171 
00172         for (i = 0; i < ncycle; i++) {
00173                 cstart = panonopt_end+i;
00174                 pos = cstart;
00175                 for (j = 0; j < cyclelen; j++) {
00176                         if (pos >= panonopt_end)
00177                                 pos -= nnonopts;
00178                         else
00179                                 pos += nopts;
00180                         swap = nargv[pos];
00181                         /* LINTED const cast */
00182                         ((char **) nargv)[pos] = nargv[cstart];
00183                         /* LINTED const cast */
00184                         ((char **)nargv)[cstart] = swap;
00185                 }
00186         }
00187 }
00188 
00189 /*
00190  * parse_long_options --
00191  *      Parse long options in argc/argv argument vector.
00192  * Returns -1 if short_too is set and the option does not match long_options.
00193  */
00194 static int
00195 parse_long_options(char * const *nargv, const char *options,
00196         const struct option *long_options, int *idx, int short_too)
00197 {
00198         char *current_argv, *has_equal;
00199         size_t current_argv_len;
00200         int i, ambiguous, match;
00201 
00202 #define IDENTICAL_INTERPRETATION(_x, _y)                                \
00203         (long_options[(_x)].has_arg == long_options[(_y)].has_arg &&    \
00204          long_options[(_x)].flag == long_options[(_y)].flag &&          \
00205          long_options[(_x)].val == long_options[(_y)].val)
00206 
00207         current_argv = place;
00208         match = -1;
00209         ambiguous = 0;
00210 
00211         optind++;
00212 
00213         if ((has_equal = strchr(current_argv, '=')) != NULL) {
00214                 /* argument found (--option=arg) */
00215                 current_argv_len = has_equal - current_argv;
00216                 has_equal++;
00217         } else
00218                 current_argv_len = strlen(current_argv);
00219 
00220         for (i = 0; long_options[i].name; i++) {
00221                 /* find matching long option */
00222                 if (strncmp(current_argv, long_options[i].name,
00223                     current_argv_len))
00224                         continue;
00225 
00226                 if (strlen(long_options[i].name) == current_argv_len) {
00227                         /* exact match */
00228                         match = i;
00229                         ambiguous = 0;
00230                         break;
00231                 }
00232                 /*
00233                  * If this is a known short option, don't allow
00234                  * a partial match of a single character.
00235                  */
00236                 if (short_too && current_argv_len == 1)
00237                         continue;
00238 
00239                 if (match == -1)        /* partial match */
00240                         match = i;
00241                 else if (!IDENTICAL_INTERPRETATION(i, match))
00242                         ambiguous = 1;
00243         }
00244         if (ambiguous) {
00245                 /* ambiguous abbreviation */
00246                 if (PRINT_ERROR)
00247                         warnx(ambig, (int)current_argv_len,
00248                              current_argv);
00249                 optopt = 0;
00250                 return (BADCH);
00251         }
00252         if (match != -1) {              /* option found */
00253                 if (long_options[match].has_arg == no_argument
00254                     && has_equal) {
00255                         if (PRINT_ERROR)
00256                                 warnx(noarg, (int)current_argv_len,
00257                                      current_argv);
00258                         /*
00259                          * XXX: GNU sets optopt to val regardless of flag
00260                          */
00261                         if (long_options[match].flag == NULL)
00262                                 optopt = long_options[match].val;
00263                         else
00264                                 optopt = 0;
00265                         return (BADARG);
00266                 }
00267                 if (long_options[match].has_arg == required_argument ||
00268                     long_options[match].has_arg == optional_argument) {
00269                         if (has_equal)
00270                                 optarg = has_equal;
00271                         else if (long_options[match].has_arg ==
00272                             required_argument) {
00273                                 /*
00274                                  * optional argument doesn't use next nargv
00275                                  */
00276                                 optarg = nargv[optind++];
00277                         }
00278                 }
00279                 if ((long_options[match].has_arg == required_argument)
00280                     && (optarg == NULL)) {
00281                         /*
00282                          * Missing argument; leading ':' indicates no error
00283                          * should be generated.
00284                          */
00285                         if (PRINT_ERROR)
00286                                 warnx(recargstring,
00287                                     current_argv);
00288                         /*
00289                          * XXX: GNU sets optopt to val regardless of flag
00290                          */
00291                         if (long_options[match].flag == NULL)
00292                                 optopt = long_options[match].val;
00293                         else
00294                                 optopt = 0;
00295                         --optind;
00296                         return (BADARG);
00297                 }
00298         } else {                        /* unknown option */
00299                 if (short_too) {
00300                         --optind;
00301                         return (-1);
00302                 }
00303                 if (PRINT_ERROR)
00304                         warnx(illoptstring, current_argv);
00305                 optopt = 0;
00306                 return (BADCH);
00307         }
00308         if (idx)
00309                 *idx = match;
00310         if (long_options[match].flag) {
00311                 *long_options[match].flag = long_options[match].val;
00312                 return (0);
00313         } else
00314                 return (long_options[match].val);
00315 #undef IDENTICAL_INTERPRETATION
00316 }
00317 
00318 /*
00319  * getopt_internal --
00320  *      Parse argc/argv argument vector.  Called by user level routines.
00321  */
00322 static int
00323 getopt_internal(int nargc, char * const *nargv, const char *options,
00324         const struct option *long_options, int *idx, int flags)
00325 {
00326         char *oli;                              /* option letter list index */
00327         int optchar, short_too;
00328         static int posixly_correct = -1;
00329 
00330         if (options == NULL)
00331                 return (-1);
00332 
00333         /*
00334          * XXX Some GNU programs (like cvs) set optind to 0 instead of
00335          * XXX using optreset.  Work around this braindamage.
00336          */
00337         if (optind == 0)
00338                 optind = optreset = 1;
00339 
00340         /*
00341          * Disable GNU extensions if POSIXLY_CORRECT is set or options
00342          * string begins with a '+'.
00343          *
00344          * CV, 2009-12-14: Check POSIXLY_CORRECT anew if optind == 0 or
00345          *                 optreset != 0 for GNU compatibility.
00346          */
00347         if (posixly_correct == -1 || optreset != 0)
00348                 posixly_correct = (getenv("POSIXLY_CORRECT") != NULL);
00349         if (*options == '-')
00350                 flags |= FLAG_ALLARGS;
00351         else if (posixly_correct || *options == '+')
00352                 flags &= ~FLAG_PERMUTE;
00353         if (*options == '+' || *options == '-')
00354                 options++;
00355 
00356         optarg = NULL;
00357         if (optreset)
00358                 nonopt_start = nonopt_end = -1;
00359 start:
00360         if (optreset || !*place) {              /* update scanning pointer */
00361                 optreset = 0;
00362                 if (optind >= nargc) {          /* end of argument vector */
00363                         place = EMSG;
00364                         if (nonopt_end != -1) {
00365                                 /* do permutation, if we have to */
00366                                 permute_args(nonopt_start, nonopt_end,
00367                                     optind, nargv);
00368                                 optind -= nonopt_end - nonopt_start;
00369                         }
00370                         else if (nonopt_start != -1) {
00371                                 /*
00372                                  * If we skipped non-options, set optind
00373                                  * to the first of them.
00374                                  */
00375                                 optind = nonopt_start;
00376                         }
00377                         nonopt_start = nonopt_end = -1;
00378                         return (-1);
00379                 }
00380                 if (*(place = nargv[optind]) != '-' ||
00381                     (place[1] == '\0' && strchr(options, '-') == NULL)) {
00382                         place = EMSG;           /* found non-option */
00383                         if (flags & FLAG_ALLARGS) {
00384                                 /*
00385                                  * GNU extension:
00386                                  * return non-option as argument to option 1
00387                                  */
00388                                 optarg = nargv[optind++];
00389                                 return (INORDER);
00390                         }
00391                         if (!(flags & FLAG_PERMUTE)) {
00392                                 /*
00393                                  * If no permutation wanted, stop parsing
00394                                  * at first non-option.
00395                                  */
00396                                 return (-1);
00397                         }
00398                         /* do permutation */
00399                         if (nonopt_start == -1)
00400                                 nonopt_start = optind;
00401                         else if (nonopt_end != -1) {
00402                                 permute_args(nonopt_start, nonopt_end,
00403                                     optind, nargv);
00404                                 nonopt_start = optind -
00405                                     (nonopt_end - nonopt_start);
00406                                 nonopt_end = -1;
00407                         }
00408                         optind++;
00409                         /* process next argument */
00410                         goto start;
00411                 }
00412                 if (nonopt_start != -1 && nonopt_end == -1)
00413                         nonopt_end = optind;
00414 
00415                 /*
00416                  * If we have "-" do nothing, if "--" we are done.
00417                  */
00418                 if (place[1] != '\0' && *++place == '-' && place[1] == '\0') {
00419                         optind++;
00420                         place = EMSG;
00421                         /*
00422                          * We found an option (--), so if we skipped
00423                          * non-options, we have to permute.
00424                          */
00425                         if (nonopt_end != -1) {
00426                                 permute_args(nonopt_start, nonopt_end,
00427                                     optind, nargv);
00428                                 optind -= nonopt_end - nonopt_start;
00429                         }
00430                         nonopt_start = nonopt_end = -1;
00431                         return (-1);
00432                 }
00433         }
00434 
00435         /*
00436          * Check long options if:
00437          *  1) we were passed some
00438          *  2) the arg is not just "-"
00439          *  3) either the arg starts with -- we are getopt_long_only()
00440          */
00441         if (long_options != NULL && place != nargv[optind] &&
00442             (*place == '-' || (flags & FLAG_LONGONLY))) {
00443                 short_too = 0;
00444                 if (*place == '-')
00445                         place++;                /* --foo long option */
00446                 else if (*place != ':' && strchr(options, *place) != NULL)
00447                         short_too = 1;          /* could be short option too */
00448 
00449                 optchar = parse_long_options(nargv, options, long_options,
00450                     idx, short_too);
00451                 if (optchar != -1) {
00452                         place = EMSG;
00453                         return (optchar);
00454                 }
00455         }
00456 
00457         if ((optchar = (int)*place++) == (int)':' ||
00458             (optchar == (int)'-' && *place != '\0') ||
00459             (oli = strchr(options, optchar)) == NULL) {
00460                 /*
00461                  * If the user specified "-" and  '-' isn't listed in
00462                  * options, return -1 (non-option) as per POSIX.
00463                  * Otherwise, it is an unknown option character (or ':').
00464                  */
00465                 if (optchar == (int)'-' && *place == '\0')
00466                         return (-1);
00467                 if (!*place)
00468                         ++optind;
00469                 if (PRINT_ERROR)
00470                         warnx(illoptchar, optchar);
00471                 optopt = optchar;
00472                 return (BADCH);
00473         }
00474         if (long_options != NULL && optchar == 'W' && oli[1] == ';') {
00475                 /* -W long-option */
00476                 if (*place)                     /* no space */
00477                         /* NOTHING */;
00478                 else if (++optind >= nargc) {   /* no arg */
00479                         place = EMSG;
00480                         if (PRINT_ERROR)
00481                                 warnx(recargchar, optchar);
00482                         optopt = optchar;
00483                         return (BADARG);
00484                 } else                          /* white space */
00485                         place = nargv[optind];
00486                 optchar = parse_long_options(nargv, options, long_options,
00487                     idx, 0);
00488                 place = EMSG;
00489                 return (optchar);
00490         }
00491         if (*++oli != ':') {                    /* doesn't take argument */
00492                 if (!*place)
00493                         ++optind;
00494         } else {                                /* takes (optional) argument */
00495                 optarg = NULL;
00496                 if (*place)                     /* no white space */
00497                         optarg = place;
00498                 else if (oli[1] != ':') {       /* arg not optional */
00499                         if (++optind >= nargc) {        /* no arg */
00500                                 place = EMSG;
00501                                 if (PRINT_ERROR)
00502                                         warnx(recargchar, optchar);
00503                                 optopt = optchar;
00504                                 return (BADARG);
00505                         } else
00506                                 optarg = nargv[optind];
00507                 }
00508                 place = EMSG;
00509                 ++optind;
00510         }
00511         /* dump back option letter */
00512         return (optchar);
00513 }
00514 
00515 #ifdef REPLACE_GETOPT
00516 /*
00517  * getopt --
00518  *      Parse argc/argv argument vector.
00519  *
00520  * [eventually this will replace the BSD getopt]
00521  */
00522 int
00523 getopt(int nargc, char * const *nargv, const char *options)
00524 {
00525 
00526         /*
00527          * We don't pass FLAG_PERMUTE to getopt_internal() since
00528          * the BSD getopt(3) (unlike GNU) has never done this.
00529          *
00530          * Furthermore, since many privileged programs call getopt()
00531          * before dropping privileges it makes sense to keep things
00532          * as simple (and bug-free) as possible.
00533          */
00534         return (getopt_internal(nargc, nargv, options, NULL, NULL, 0));
00535 }
00536 #endif /* REPLACE_GETOPT */
00537 
00538 /*
00539  * getopt_long --
00540  *      Parse argc/argv argument vector.
00541  */
00542 int
00543 getopt_long(int nargc, char * const *nargv, const char *options,
00544     const struct option *long_options, int *idx)
00545 {
00546 
00547         return (getopt_internal(nargc, nargv, options, long_options, idx,
00548             FLAG_PERMUTE));
00549 }
00550 
00551 /*
00552  * getopt_long_only --
00553  *      Parse argc/argv argument vector.
00554  */
00555 int
00556 getopt_long_only(int nargc, char * const *nargv, const char *options,
00557     const struct option *long_options, int *idx)
00558 {
00559 
00560         return (getopt_internal(nargc, nargv, options, long_options, idx,
00561             FLAG_PERMUTE|FLAG_LONGONLY));
00562 }
